The food is of a decent standard, and the starter in particular are always great, though as a note of caution I invariably find myself too full to enjoy my main, so consider sharing!

A2sBYdhazpvFWo14_jMiVQ.text: A little piece of MexicoThere is a little piece of Mexico hidden away in a quiet side street in Covent Garden. The restaurant is lively and has a fun atmosphere - it is decorated with Mexican memorabilia, and is rustic. The food is filling and quite good value for London - it is the best Mexican food I have ever had, and this is the only place I would go to eat it. I've been going there for over 10 years now, and it is still a favorite. Great for parties, groups, couples and families in the daytime or early evening.

cJ9MPGs3ygDFn96LkHMTqA.text: Great place. Fajitas were excellent. Beef was juicy and tender. Very busy - recommend reservations even on Monday and Tuesday.

GpGuEPQaJpKDRc8wpDNieg.text: Love this place. Authentic Mexican feel, the food is great the cocktails and wine are great and the service is great. It is a buzzing little place which is packed out but this adds to the lively, fun atmosphere. The food is delicious, nice and fresh and you can see it being cooked in the kitchen. The whole place just feels so energetic which makes the whole dining experience thoroughly enjoyable. I recommend this little taste of mexico to any food loverfajitas every time!

3ON2_W3Fvd_Ipo0pJl-nHw.text: This place has great mexican food. The restaurant is fantastic. It is often very busy at night but the marguaritas are the best. They have a big range of food from which you can choose from. When I was there I didn't know what to eat as there were so many things to choose from. The waiter recommended our meals and it was fantastic. The cocktails were great too. The atmosphere is vibrant and fun. This is the place to be.

FLs2VJtJNXi5SaQ4FfingA.text: Really good Mexican restaurant. Good atmosphere and the food is always great. Good selection of drinks.

ULe5g6CbFR37l9RhAfy5Nw.text: This is not an authentic Mexican restaurant, if you see enchiladas made with flour tortillas or any mention of duck and soy sauce, you can safely say that you will not have a an authentic Mexican meal. The food is overpriced, 5 pounds for squashed avocado. You would think that for those prices they would make their own maize tortillas, it isn't exactly rocket science. I struggled to find anything in the menu that reminded me of good old home cooking. If you are a Mexican then stay away, if you've never tried Mexican food then this restaurant will not change this. If you want a taste of authentic Mexican cuisine you would be better off walking to Wahaca instead.

vJXctMbPrGVlhmet5YMgbA.text: The £10 lunchtime special at Cafe Pacifico is pretty hard to knock. A choice of main courses and two bottles of beer (or a margarita) will satisfy most people. The Chimichangas are superb, as are the Enchiladas. But no matter how good the lunchtime special is, it is the full menu that will tempt most people to return. The Taquiza, although on the pricier side, is awesome. The Street Tacos, Burritos and Alabre Tepoztlan are too. Even basics like the Chilli-con-carne are top-notch but might prove somewhat fiery to many palates. Vegetarian options are available, but limited. Best bet to non-meat-eaters will probably be the Tostada. The bill can sometimes take a while to arrive but then that's probably because the staff know that movement shouldn't really be attempted on such a full stomach!

YvAcpnk4BD8kysCi0G_6-w.text: There's a lively atmosphere in here and the food is fantastic. I have not yet found a better place for Mex in London.

LUK609JZHbNK2YhvYKtAsQ.text: Though the wait at Pacifico can be forever on a Friday night -- I think we waited about 2 hours despite a good deal of negotiating with the hostess -- you can at least hang out in the bar and get some drinks and appetizers. Careful, though, the bar area will be packed, too. The 25 year margarita was my favorite, though there were some others that sounded good, especially since they had a decent tequila selection. They also had a decent selection of Mexican beers, including Negro Modelo and Pacifico. Though some of their menu items are decidedly inauthentic, and they know it, the fajitas are good and the salsa is spicy. I'm still looking for a place in London that makes its own tortilla chips, though.

cIljhfCsCNmnxwgJKdqiow.text: Cafe Pacifico is the best and most authentic Mexican Restaurant I've been to in London so far. Don't fall for those other cheap chains with inticing 2 for 1's or the tex-mex wannabies that pop up every now and then. Chimichangas are always a winner, burritos, enchilladas and quesadillas are all awesome, guacamole is top notch be naughty and try a sopapilla for desert. They also serve tex-mex incarnations, such as nacho cheese platters, which I've tried but not really enjoyed. Although their homemade salsa is very nice. As for drinks, Mexican beer is so underrated and No! Corona is NOT a Mexican beer!!! Negra Modelo seems to be the drink of choice for most of Pacifico's patrons, as it was mine, until they brought in Bohemia. I'd only had it once in San Diego a few years ago but my tastebuds have longed for it ever since. They have a special lunch deal where you can one of the popular mains for about half price at £6 or you can have 2 beers with you main for £10. Otherwise mains will set you back around £9-13 excluding service charge pocket change for the orgasmic taste you will be rewarding your stomach with. 5/5, I'd give it 6/5 if i could.

JR68Ims8r9I7yf9cMd_NzQ.text: My friend and I got extremly ill here - quiate a few years ago now.    I had to catch a plane the next morning -- threw up the whole way over the Atlantic.  She had to catch a train home and ended up doing the same thing!  Terrible.

cYhB-1czFtsu1PH4p1QZYw.text: I had heard a lot about this place before going for a meal and had been craving a Mexican feast! The restaurant was packed, and judging from other feedback this is generally the case. We squeezed to the bar and had a few beers while waiting. The atmosphere was buzzing and the place was heaving, defiantely more suitable for a gang of friends on a night out rather than a romantic meal. When we finally got to our table service was friendly if a little slow. The food was.. well actually nothing that special. Mexican food is hard to get completely wrong and and didn't think this was any better than I would easily do at home. I wouldn't rush back.

gIWwTyHCRhuiyHNY2MK8fQ.text: Best advice about this place is to do mid-week and book a table in advance. The food is OK to good, let's face it most Mexican restaurants seem to serve the same ingredients - tortilla, tomatoes, beans, avocado - in different combinations over and over again. The drinks though are great, especially the frozen margaritas. Enjoy the vibe over dinner, then pop next door for cocktails at The Langley - much more civilised.

HiXuhQdHHvEnNcKerLrOaw.text: This place has a lively atmosphere, but is below par compared to restaurants serving "mexican" food in the US. If you don't know any better, then you may like it...and I would know since I am mexican. Also the service tends to be shoddy (I gave the place two chances)...last night when I was there the server essentially tossed the food and drinks on the table and never asked if we needed anything.

6ehS-P6oNseDHp72RAnKnQ.text: Possibly the best Mexican restaurant in London...amazing food and cool sounds...Chimichangas and Dos Equis all the way!

a6muT0UtMwqdw6lFystqcA.text: I see that a lot of people find the drinks to be a novelty - but if you have any expectations higher than a home made Old El Paso, like I did, you will not only be disappointed, but you may also have some digestive discomfort. Upon entering you will be herded towards a crowded bar area to buy some expensive cocktails, which on an empty stomach churning some after work drinks may seems a little undesirable, until out of boredom decide to pony up for a pitcher of cocktails, which turns out to be a jug of ice with some booze in it - somewhere. When you finally sit down, by which point you are so famished you feverishly devour a bowl of salty tortilla chips. The menu is strangely repetitive, and the variations between tacos and tortillas come out looking exactly the same. The refried beans looks like something you would find in a joke shop, and probably tastes the same. The rice is also refried. The beef 'tacos' I had were also greasy, and incredibly salty. My friend who had the chilli con carne was very reminiscent of a Bombay Badboy from the Pot Noodle range. When the bill arrives you start to wonder why you didn't go to a real restaurant, and instead spend the rest of the evening in isolation so as not to upset people sat within a three metre radius of you. Adiós Cafe Pacifico.

qoXZBCW39ct4hy0N2LHWLQ.text: A month into our move to London from California, we thought we'd venture out and give this Mexican restaurant a shot given that it got good reviews in one of our restaurant guide books.  Big mistake.  We obviously had eaten good Mexican food too recently to find anything redeemable at this place.  For the time being, I will stick with the Whole Foods Mexican section and my own kitchen.  Much better Mexican food!

oIpOtuwHLu65LOi6B2-3aA.text: I recently dined here with a few friends. Despite its convenient location (moments from the tube station), I wasn't really taken with the food. The service was ok, but the atmosphere was a little too crowded for me. Wouldn't go back.

Foh6zyPRltdbl_qCiq9_jA.text: If you are in Covent Garden around lunch time and have a craving for Mexican food, this is your place. It's cafe style, fajitas, burritos, and tacos. Good authentic flavors. A lively bar with a variety of tequilas (no self respecting Mexican bar would only serve Jose what's it's face). I'm constantly explaining to both Brits and Americans the vast difference between real tequila and that synthetic shite...

hMaC7isSAXnfNgDMevKZ2Q.text: Two years after the fact, this is the only restaurant that I really remember from my trip to London. I felt like I was back home in California. Tequila selection is good . I could get a real cocktail for once (a girl can only drink so much beer), and all of my Americanized Mexican favorites. It was expensive, like everything else in London, but I managed to go there twice during my three-week visit. Just be prepared for a long wait.

QYNim_-DHT7syRYTTiUsbQ.text: Friendly atmosphere and good service. The staff are quick and attentive. The cocktails were very imaginative and tasty. The food was fresh and served promptly. overall, a pleasant, quick and good value-for-money dinner

8RpjXUPycjvebFisSnpC3w.text: Too loud and bad service but great Tex-Mex (for London)

0Et7bJJ5FOab_IJO7VAsVw.text: It was a busy place since there is not alot of Mexican rest in the area of London.  I went in there and craving chips and salsa and ate a few bowl and it was not the best but it was better than I expected from a London tex mex restaurant.  The cheese enchiladas were not very good they were too sweet or something  but the chicken enchiladas  definitely were the best thing they tasted farther than i expected in a central London mex rest..  The waitress made me some amazing sweet brewed tea with lemmons- I have to love her for that.

zI_MKKDR0ad7mqxrrnKSrA.text: I love this restaurant! Big portions, delicious food and stellar margheritas. All for a nice low price. Oh and try the Sopapillas dessert - it's a winner!

WbXrujVj0jcDd4xaeApEjQ.text: My Valentine and I dipped our chips into the salsa and were instantly transported back home to Texas and Arizona (respectively), as a mystery ingredient instantly triggered childhood memories of family barbacoas and drunken pachangas. Apart from the accents of the servers and the strange white sauce on my enchildas suizas, this was pretty damn good Tex Mex, in Covent Garden, of all places!

iO8ZKCcV2WADznsxKWmNeA.text: Love, love, love it! Cafe Pacifico is just fantastic. Always busy (even on a Tuesday which shows how lovely it is) and always good quality, tasty food. The waiters are great at explaining dishes, helping you choose, and are so accomodating if you want to make slight changes. Went there for a meal with a friend who had just got engaged and arranged with the waitress to bring over champagne as a surprise, and open it as the friend arrived, which she did with perfect timing, and joined in the congratulations, which was so lovely and friendly. I keep returning to Cafe Pacifico - both for the lovely food and the fantastic cocktails. Ok, it's not cheap, admittedly, but you won't go wrong for a fantastic night out in London.
